reck
Interface Entity

All Known Implementing Classes:
EntityImpl
public interface Entity

An interface that act as an entity containing a list of mentions.

Method Summary

mentions

Mention[] mentions()
Returns an array of mentions for the current entity.

getMentionsAsList

java.util.List<Mention> getMentionsAsList()
Returns a List of mentions for the current entity. If there are no mentions, then a (non-null) List<Mention> of size 0 will be returned. The list has new list structure but pointers to, not copies of the mentions. That is, the returned list is mutable, and simply adding to or deleting items from it is safe, but beware changing the contents of the mentions.

getMentionsAsSet

java.util.Set<Mention> getMentionsAsSet()

setMentions

void setMentions(Mention[] mentions)
Sets the children of this Entity. If given null, this method prints a warning and sets the Entity's mentions to the canonical zero-length Mention[] array.

setMentions

void setMentions(java.util.List<Mention> mentionsList)
Set the mentions of this entity to the given list. This method is implemented in the Entity class by converting the List into an entity array and calling the array-based method. Subclasses which use a List-based representation of mentions should override this method. This implementation allows the case that the List is null: it yields an entity with no mentions (represented by a canonical zero-length Mention() array).

numMentions

int numMentions()
Says how many children a tree node has in its local tree. Can be used on an arbitrary Tree. Being a leaf is defined as having no children.

indexOfMention

int indexOfMention(Mention mention)
Returns the position of an Mention in the mention list, if present, or -1 if it is not present. Mentions are checked for presence with equals().

attributes

Charseq[] attributes()
Returns an array of mentions for the current entity.

getAttributesAsList

java.util.List<Charseq> getAttributesAsList()
Returns a List of attributes for the current entity. If there are no mentions, then a (non-null) List<Charseq> of size 0 will be returned. The list has new list structure but pointers to, not copies of the attributes. That is, the returned list is mutable, and simply adding to or deleting items from it is safe, but beware changing the contents of the attributes.

setAttributes

void setAttributes(Charseq[] attributes)
Sets the children of this Entity. If given null, this method prints a warning and sets the Entity's mentions to the canonical zero-length Mention[] array.

setAttributes

void setAttributes(java.util.List<Charseq> attributesList)
Set the attributes of this entity to the given list. This method is implemented in the Entity class by converting the List into an entity array and calling the array-based method. Subclasses which use a List-based representation of attributes should override this method. This implementation allows the case that the List is null: it yields an entity with no attributes (represented by a canonical zero-length Charseq() array).

numAttributes

int numAttributes()
Says how many attributes an entity has. Can be used on an arbitrary Charseq.

indexOfAttribute

int indexOfAttribute(Charseq attribute)
Returns the position of an attribute in the mention list, if present, or -1 if it is not present. Attributes are checked for presence with equals().
